creator: elemeur@fr.as24.com
text:
Hello,

It appears that defining a DefaultContext in the server (in the host level) 
makes some troubles with the WebappClassLoader :
the changes of the classes are not detected any more.

Here is a part of my server.xml :

...
<DefaultContext>

<Resource name="jdbc/gescom" auth="Container"
              type="javax.sql.DataSource"/> 
<ResourceParams name="jdbc/gescom">
                  <parameter>
                    <name>factory</name>
                    
<value>org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSourceFactory</value>
                  </parameter>
                  <parameter>
                    <name>driverClassName</name>
                    <value>oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver</value>
                  </parameter>
                  <parameter>
                    <name>url</name>
                    <value>jdbc:oracle:thin:@xxx:????:yyyy</value>
                  </parameter>
                  <parameter>
                    <name>username</name>
                    <value>toto</value>
                  </parameter>
                  <parameter>
                    <name>password</name>
                    <value>toto</value>
                  </parameter>
                  <parameter>
                    <name>maxActive</name>
                    <value>1</value>
                  </parameter>
                  <parameter>
                    <name>maxIdle</name>
                    <value>1</value>
                  </parameter>
                  <parameter>
                    <name>maxWait</name>
                    <value>-1</value>
                  </parameter>
                  <parameter>
                    <name>removeAbandoned</name>
                    <value>true</value>
                  </parameter>

                </ResourceParams>

</DefaultContext>
...

My context :

...
<Context path="/eloiise" docBase="C:\j2ee\eclipse\workspace\ELOIISE\eloiise" 
debug="5" reloadable="true" >
	<Logger className="org.apache.catalina.logger.FileLogger"
                     prefix="eloiise_log." suffix=".txt"
        	  timestamp="true"/>

By deleting the DefaultContext, the WebappClassLoader works and detects the 
changes in my classes when i develop (like WebappClassLoader:   Resource '/WEB-
INF/classes/i18n/index_fr.properties' was modified; Date is now: Fri May 16 
16:41:54 GMT+01:00 2003 Was: Fri May 16 16:39:08 GMT+01:00 2003)

What's wrong ???

NB : it's the same behavior with the 4.1.18

Greetings from France
Envel

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
Please note that it makes our (the tomcat developers) lives a lot easier if 
you ask questions like this on the tomcat-user list before filing a bug 
report. This reduces the number of invalid bug reports and enables us to 
concentrate on the genuine bugs.

Nothing is wrong. Tomcat is doing exactly what you asked it to.

DefaultContext has a reloadable attribute that you have not set and therefore 
defaults to false.

Your Context will only override settings in the DefaultContext if the override 
attribute is set to true in the Context (which it isn't) and hence the 
reloadable attribute in your context definition is ignored.
